versos: (zalmunna) Judges 8:5 - "He said to the men of Succoth, 'Give me some loaves of bread; they are for the men who are with me, and we are pursuing Zebah and zalmunna, the kings of Midian.'";;;
(nebat) Judges 6:11 - The angel of the Lord came and sat down under the oak in Ophrah that belonged to Joash the Abiezrite

(ahijah) 1 Kings 14:2 - "And Jeroboam said to his wife, 'Arise, and disguise yourself, that it not be known that you are the wife of Jeroboam, and go to Shiloh. Behold, ahijah the prophet is there, who said of me that I should be king over this people.'";;;
(shemaiah) Nehemiah 3:29 - After them Zadok the son of Immer repaired next to his own house. After him shemaiah the son of Shecaniah
(fig) Luke 13:6 - He spake also this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.;;;
(pull) Proverbs 20:1 - "Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.";;;
(samaria) "But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and samaria, and to the end of the earth." - Acts 1:8;;;
(abijah) 2 Chronicles 13:2 - "He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mothers name was Maakah, the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. There was war between abijah and Jeroboam.";;;
(reed) Matthew 11:7 - As John's disciples were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: "What did you go out into the wilderness to see A reed swayed by the wind;;;
(idol) "You shall have no other gods before me." - Exodus 20:3;;;
(baasha) 1 Kings 16:1 - "Then the word of the LORD came to Jehu son of Hanani concerning baasha:";;;

(jehu) 2 Kings 10:31 - "Yet jehu was not careful to keep the law of the Lord, the God of Israel, with all his heart. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, which he had caused Israel to commit."';;;
(hanani) 2 Chronicles 16:7 - At that time hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah and said to him: Because you relied on the king of Aram and not on the Lord your God
(omri) "omri did evil in the eyes of the Lord and sinned more than all those before him." - 1 Kings 16:25;;;
